subject: IDES
title: Topics in Interior Design
info: in-depth investigation of specific topic, announced in advance.

subject: IDES
title: ID Studio I
info: theories used to solve interior design problems related to human behavior. design process. communication skills that are required for interior design profession.
prereqInfo: interior design pre-major or interior environments minor

subject: IDES
title: ID Studio II
info: introduction to interior design programming as method for understanding behaviors/requirements of humans in spaces. use of color in three-dimensional environments. developing communication skills. problem-solving.
prereqInfo: [1601 or dha 1601] with grade of at least c-, interior design pre-major

subject: IDES
title: Work Experience
info: supervised work experience in business, industry, or government, related to student's area of study.
prereqInfo: plan submitted/approved by [adviser, internship supervisor], written approval of supervisor, instr consent

subject: IDES
title: ID Studio III
info: expanding presentation skills, visual communication of design process. design of interior environment as influenced by neighborhood, adjacent structures, regional context, diverse cultures.
prereqInfo: [1602 or dha 1602] with grade of at least c-, pass portfolio review, interior design major

subject: IDES
title: ID Studio IV
info: relationship between exterior/interior design as it pertains to building construction. methods/materials, principles of structure, building systems, construction details. interface of electrical, hvac, plumbing systems in buildings.

subject: IDES
title: Int Materials & Specifications
info: environmental issues, from global to interior spaces. effect of building codes/legislation, social awareness. functional/aesthetic relation of materials/resources to interior design.
prereqInfo: [pass portfolio review, interior design major] or interior environments minor or design minor or instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Structures, Systems, Safety
info: codes, standards, regulations, and guidelines that govern design of interior space and support life safety. integration of building systems. structures for non-residential/residential occupancy. building/energy codes. lectures, guest speakers, field trips.

subject: IDES
title: Computer Aided Des: Int Design
info: application of two-/three-dimensional computer drawing in design/visualization of interior space. autocad software used on windows-based system.
prereqInfo: [interior design major, pass portfolio review] or instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Computer Applications I
info: computer-aided design, its role in interior design.  use of software applications for construction drawings, two-/three-dimensional representation. modeling for interior design problem-solving/presentation.
prereqInfo: interior design major

subject: IDES
title: Int & Furn to 1750
info: study of european and american interiors and furnishings, including furniture, textiles, and decorative objects.

subject: IDES
title: Int/Furn to Present
info: european/american interiors/furnishings, including furniture, textiles, and decorative objects.

subject: IDES
title: Topics in Interior Design
info: in-depth investigation of specific topic.

subject: IDES
title: Field Study: Natl/Intl
info: faculty-directed field study in national or international setting.
prereqInfo: instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Interior Design Studio V
info: advanced interior design problems dealing with small to medium scale spaces. emphasizes special-needs populations.

subject: IDES
title: ID Studio VI
info: interior design problems dealing with medium-scale spaces. focuses on medium office design.
prereqInfo: ides 3605

subject: IDES
title: Lighting Design
info: lighting as dynamic design element. psychological aspects of light color/quality/sources. photometrics, codes, daylighting, energy conservation. how lighting impacts health/well-being. integrating lighting with interior/architectural elements. lighting/fixture design. computer visualization. lecture, assignments, projects.

subject: IDES
title: ID Ethics & Pro Pr
info: business of interior design, professional ethics, and responsible design. ethical theory/conduct. responsibility to business, clients, colleagues, and community at large and globally.
prereqInfo: 2604 or dha 2604; or interior environments minor

subject: IDES
title: Computer Applications II
info: advanced concepts/terms in computer modeling. computer graphics, three-dimensional modeling, rendering, animation to provide representation strategies for interior design problem-solving/presentation. applications such as autodesk revit, autocad, autodesk 3ds max design.

subject: IDES
title: Capstone Project
info: indivdualizes honors experience by connecting aspects of major program with special academic interests.
prereqInfo: interior design honors

subject: IDES
title: Dir Study in Interior Design
info: independent study in interior design under tutorial guidance.
prereqInfo: undergrad, instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Internship
info: supervised work experience relating activity in business, industry, or government to student's area of study. integrative paper or project may be required.
prereqInfo: 4607, instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Interior Design Studio VII
info: advanced interior design problems dealing with large scale spaces. historic precedent, adaptive use, renovation.
prereqInfo: [ides 2604] or [dha 2604]] with grade of at least c-

subject: IDES
title: ID Thesis
info: comprehensive independent interior design project developed from student-conducted research/program developed in 4615w.
prereqInfo: [4615w or dha 4615w], [4607 or dha 4607] with grade of at least c-

subject: IDES
title: ID Research
info: research methods for programming interior design solutions. developing comprehensive program. issues that affect interior design research/practices.

subject: IDES
title: Sustain Cmmrcl Interior Dsgn
info: intent, requirements, submittals, technologies/strategies to achieve leed ci standards in existing, new construction, or tenant improvement projects.

subject: IDES
title: Lighting Design Innovations
info: this course deepens students' understanding of the relationship between interior and architectural lighting design issues, strategies, and methods in contemporary practice. it investigates an integrated approach to lighting design to consider lighting innovations and emerging trends in health and comfort, smart technologies, energy and performance, metrics and standards, and assessment processes and tools. assignments incrementally introduce students to related lighting issues to enable students to gain hands-on knowledge and application of related design issues through a small design project. field studies and guest lectures provide insights into innovations in industry and professional perspectives on emerging technologies and systems integration.

subject: IDES
title: Topics in Interior Design
info: in-depth investigation of specific topic, announced in advance.
prereqInfo: jr or sr or grad student

subject: IDES
title: Directed Study
info: independent study in interior design under tutorial guidance.
prereqInfo: jr or sr or grad student

subject: IDES
title: Work experience
info: faculty-directed internship

subject: IDES
title: Lighting Design
info: lighting as dynamic design element. psychological aspects of light color/quality/sources. photometrics, codes, daylighting, energy conservation. how lighting impacts health/well-being. integrating lighting with interior/architectural elements. lighting/fixture design. computer visualization. lecture, assignments, projects.

subject: IDES
title: Sustain Cmmrcl Interior Dsgn
info: intent, requirements, submittals, technologies/strategies to achieve leed ci standards in existing, new construction, or tenant improvement projects.

subject: IDES
title: Lighting Design Innovations
info: this course deepens students' understanding of the relationship between interior and architectural lighting design issues, strategies, and methods in contemporary practice. it investigates an integrated approach to lighting design to consider lighting innovations and emerging trends in health and comfort, smart technologies, energy and performance, metrics and standards, and assessment processes and tools. assignments incrementally introduce students to related lighting issues to enable students to gain hands-on knowledge and application of related design issues through a small design project. field studies and guest lectures provide insights into innovations in industry and professional perspectives on emerging technologies and systems integration.

subject: IDES
title: Topics in Interior Design
info: in-depth investigation of topic, announced in advance.

subject: IDES
title: Professional Seminar
info: professional development issues/trends.

subject: IDES
title: Readings
info: independent study, review of books/periodicals under tutorial guidance.
prereqInfo: instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Directed Study
info: directed study in interior design.
prereqInfo: instr consent

subject: IDES
title: Plan B Master's Project
info: plan b master's project.
prereqInfo: [dha or design] master's student, instr consent
